summary: FINRA is a securities industry organization that regulates over 3,400 U.S. securities firms. The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) also regulates the industry. Reviewing FINRA's regulatory work is critical to SEC's mission of protecting investors and maintaining fair, efficient markets. For example, SEC reviews FINRA's examinations of securities firms and may identify deficiencies. But we found that SEC doesn't have documented procedures for determining which...
title: Securities Regulation: SEC Could Take Further Actions to Help Achieve Its FINRA Oversight Goals
